A Centre_of_mass is a type of
that is the centre of the mass of a body. The relative position of the Centre_of_mass within the body is an invariant datum relative to rotation and translation. The Centre_of_mass is a characteristic of a part, not its shape.
If a shape representation is present, the Centre_of_mass is usually derivable from the shape representation. However, as a characteristic of a part, it may be pre-defined in order to reflect a requirement.
In order to convey the information about the actual centre of mass of a geometric model, the use of with value 'centroid' for its attribute 'property_type' is appropriate.

the in which the property is applicable. The values of geometry related properties are specified relative to a .
A Centre_of_mass may be specified in different coordinate spaces for different dimensioning applications.
a point in three-dimensional space that defines the location of a Centre_of_mass in the .

A Class_category_association is an association of a with a . Additionally, this assignment specifies if the usage of one or more objects belonging to this , is mandatory or optional for all products of that .
The assignment of a to a does not replace the association of single members of the to the .
the that is associated with the .
the for which the is valid.

specifies whether the objects referring to the associated have to be used or may be used (optional) for products within the referenced . A value of 'true' indicates that the usage is mandatory.
The specification category 'radio' may be associated 'optional' to the product class of a car; the specification category 'engine' is an example for a 'mandatory' association.
A Class_condition_association is an association of a with a . The meaning of this association is specified further by the attribute condition_type.
specifies the that is assigned to the .
specifies the for which the is valid.

the text that provides further information about the Class_condition_association.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Class_inclusion_association.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Digital_document_definition is a type of
that collects files that are archived on an optical computer disc, magnetic, electronic storage, or a combination thereof. A Digital_document_definition may consist of one or many component s.
a computer interpretable realization of the Digital_document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Digital_file is a type of
that contains computer interpretable data and is stored on an electronic device.
the which is contained in the Digital_file
A Direction is a

the words by which the Direction is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Document is a logical document that serves as the identifier for a container for some product data.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the classifications of the Document. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Document.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Document.
the words by which the Document is known.
the versions of the Document.
A Document_assignment is a mechanism to associate a document with the objects, where the assigned document provides information about the object it is associated to.
the , a , a , or a that is used to provide information.
the objects that information is provided for. A document assigned to may provide further description of the input or output of that activity.
the word or group of the words that convey the subject or sub contents of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Document_category is a classification of a with respect to specific criteria. The specific criteria are covered in the name attribute.

the text that provides further information about the Document_category.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Document_category.

the words by which the Document_category is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified. Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'catalogue': The assigned document is the catalogue in which the associated object is listed; The document can be the catalogue of the manufacturer.
'manual': The assigned document is the handbook that is supplied for the associated object;
'specification': The assigned document specifies the considerations that lead to the design finally chosen for the associated object.
the organization in which the classification is defined.
specifies the objects with which a particular Document_category is associated.

A Document_content_property specifies characteristics precising the content of a or of a . At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a Document_content_property is referred by a , the characteristics apply to all individual objects, whereas in the case where it is referred by a , the characteristics apply on an individual basis.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document_content_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Document_content_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Document_content_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the language or languages which are used in the characterized objects. The value of this attribute need not be specified. 'Japanese' and 'German' are examples for the fact that annotation on a drawing is provided in the language 'Japanese' or 'German' respectively.

the words by which the Document_content_property is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the scale that is used in the or in the the Document_content_property is referred by. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Document_creation_property specifies characteristics of or of objects. It specifies the context of the creation of the object. At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object.
In the case where a Document_creation_property is referred by a the characteristics apply to all individual objects, whereas in the case it is referred by a , the characteristics apply on an individual basis.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document_content_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the computer application used to create the or object. The value of this attribute need not be specified. 'Postscript Printer Driver' is an example for a creating interface of a Physical_document.
'SYSTEM-C-STL' is an example for a creating interface of a Physical_model in the case of a stereolithographic model.
the computer application or the machine which is used to create the object that is characterized.

the text that provides further information about the Document_creation_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Document_creation_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the words by which the Document_creation_property is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the operating system that is used to execute the computer application that created the characterized object. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Document_definition is one of potentially more alternative representations of a . A Document_version may have more than one representation.
A version of a logical document, which contains a shape model, may be represented in the different native formats of two 3D CAD systems.
the version of the logical document that is being represented.

the location of a Document_definition, where all its constituents can be found. The value of this attribute need not be specified. Different common locations represent alternative representations of the same physical location.
characteristics of the content of the Document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
further details of the creation of the Document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Document_definition.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Document_definition.

the words by which the Document_definition is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the format of the document represented by Document_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the size of the represented document. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Document_definition_relationship is a relationship between two objects.

the text that provides further information about the Document_definition_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the second of the two objects related by the Document_definition_relationship. The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.
the first of the two objects related by the Document_definition_relationship. The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

A Document_version is a release of a Document.

the text that provides further information about the Document_version.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Document_version.
the logical document the Document_version is a version of.
A Document_version_relationship is a relationship between two objects.

the text that provides further information about the Document_version_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the second of the two objects related by the Document_version_relationship. The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.
the first of the two objects related by the Document_version_relationship. The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'derivation': The business object defines a deriving relationship where the related Document_version is based on the relating Document_version which is an earlier version of the same or of a different Document;
'hierarchy': The business object defines a hierarchical relationship where the related Document_version is a sub version of the relating Document_version; 'Revision 1.1' and 'revision 1.2' are examples of sub-versions of 'version 1'.
'sequence': The business object defines a version sequence where the relating Document_version is the preceding version and the related Document_version is the following version.
'supplied document': The business object defines a relationship between two Document_version objects representing the same object in different organizational contexts. The different organizational contexts can be represented by different general organizational data associations with the related Document_version objects.

A General_property_definition is a type of
that is specified by the attribute 'property_type'. The noise emission of an engine, maintenance intervals, wheel base, and duration of parts, or electrical properties are examples for a General_property_definition.
A General_requirement_version_relationship is a type of

A General_shape_dependent_property is a type of
that defines a user-defined characteristic of an object. The 'property_value' specified by a General_shape_dependent_property is derived from geometry. The General_shape_dependent_property may be used for the purpose of validation of geometric models. If a geometry model is exchanged between two partners, the calculation of various properties of the bodies, such as centre of mass, overall surface, or overall volume, is performed by originator and recipient. When comparing these set of values, the existence of deficiencies in the received model can be easily detected.
the value that is given for a particular characteristic.
the unit in which the General_shape_dependent_property is expressed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Model_property is a mechanism to assign a to an , a , or a .
the that is assigned to an , a , or a .
the model to which a is assigned.

A Model_property_assignment is an assignment of a to objects. In the case of a welding operation, the welding points as a part of a wireframe model can be associated with a process operation to describe the locations where the robot has to weld for a welding process operation.
the that is associated to an application object.
the application objects for which a is provided.
specifies the context in which a Model_property_assignment is applicable. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Moments_of_inertia is a type of
that describes the matrix of inertia of a rigid body.

the Cartesian_coordinate_space in which the property is applicable. The values of geometry related properties are specified relative to a . The for the Moments_of_inertia is defined within the coordinate space. A Moments_of_inertia may be specified in different coordinate spaces for different purposes.

the 9 inertia coefficients. The matrix defined by the 'inertia_value' is symmetric with respect to the main diagonal. For that reason, the values of the coefficients are equal, if mirrored along this diagonal. As a consequence, there are 6 different values in the 'inertia_value'.
the which was used to calculate the 'inertia_value'.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

representing a quantity expressed with a numerical value and a unit.

A Process_operation_definition is a specification of an activity that may be included in a Process_plan. A Process_operation_definition characterizes a manufacturing or control operation.
Process_operation_definition as well as may be associated with organizational data using, e.g., . The reason for having these data available for both types of objects is the requirement to associate Process_operation_definition with organizational data in both a context independent and a context dependent way (the context is a particular ).
In the case where an instance of Process_operation_definition is associated with, e.g., two objects (e.g., as location), once context independent and once context dependent, the two locations need not be the same, but should be related in a way that the context dependent location should be a specialization of the context independent location (e.g., a particular assembly line in a plant).
the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Process_operation_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Process_operation_definition.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Process_operation_definition.

the words by which the Process_operation_definition is known.
'operation Z10.114' is an example for name.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the type of the Process_operation_definition.
'stamping', 'milling', 'drilling', 'welding', 'casting', and 'painting' are examples for process_type.
the identification of a particular version of a Process_operation_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Process_operation_definition_relationship is a relationship between two Process_operation_definition objects.

the text that provides further information about the Process_operation_definition_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the second of the two objects related by the Process_operation_definition_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

the first of the two objects related by the Process_operation_definition_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.
A Process_operation_input_or_output is an input or expected result of a .
the set of objects that are affected by the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Process_operation_input_or_output.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the element that plays the role of the input or the output for the operation.
the that the Process_operation_input_or_output is associated with.

the geometrical between the local coordinate system of the element acting as Process_operation_input_or_output, and the reference coordinate system. The reference coordinate system is either the coordinate system of the reference tool, if present for the concerned or, if no reference tool is present, the coordinate system of the itself.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies whether the identified element plays the role of an input or an output for the operation.

A Process_operation_occurrence is a usage of a in a . This association states that the is part of the .
This mechanism enables the reuse of a in the context of more than one .
the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Process_operation_occurrence. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the of the Process_operation_occurrence for the case where none of the tools associated by plays the role of a reference tool defining the reference coordinate space. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the that defines the in a .
the identifier for the Process_operation_occurrence.
the to which the is assigning a .
A Process_operation_occurrence_relationship is a relationship between two Process_operation_occurrence objects.
the interval of time within which both objects have to take place in order to be declared as simultaneous. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Process_operation_occurrence_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the second of the two objects related by the Process_operation_occurrence_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

the first of the two objects related by the Process_operation_occurrence_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

the time which shall elapse, at least, between the completion of the relating and the start of the related . The refer-enced shall have a definition that is a .
The 'polishing' must not be started less than 2 hours after the 'painting' ended.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Process_operation_resource_assignment is a mechanism to associate a resource with a .
the tool that is used to perform the operation.
the with which the resource is associated.

the geometrical between the local coordinate system of the Process_operation_resource_assignment and the reference coordinate system.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The reference coordinate system is either the coordinate system of the reference tool (if present) for the concerned or (if no reference tool is present) the coordinate system of the itself. In the case where the value of the attribute reference_tool is 'true', no transformation shall be defined.
the rationale behind the use of the resource for a particular . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies whether or not the resource identified by the Process_operation_resource_assignment plays the role of the reference tool for the occurrence of an operation. In the case where the value of this attribute is 'true', all geometric transformations within the scope of the are defined with respect to the local coordinate system of the resource identified by the Process_operation_resource_assignment. There shall not be more than one resource playing the role of the reference tool for one . In the case where the resource is not represented as a , the value of the attribute reference_tool shall be 'false'.
A Process_plan is manufacturing planning information, necessary to realize or produce a particular version of a . A Process_plan might represent a particular version of a Process_plan.
the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Process_plan. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Process_plan.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Process_plan.

the words by which the Process_plan is known.
'ABO Engine Cylinder block machining line' is an example for name.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the set of objects that are produced by the operations of the Process_plan. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification of a particular version of a Process_plan. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Process_plan_relationship is a relationship between two objects.
If a part shall be manufactured at two different manufacturing sites, e.g., one at Paris and the other at Bordeaux, there will be two different process plans, that may be related by a Process_plan_relationship.

the text that provides further information about the Process_plan_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the second of the two objects related by the Process_plan_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

the first of the two objects related by the Process_plan_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

A Process_property_assignment is a type of
that assigns a property value to process related objects.
the objects that are described by the property value.
A Process_state_relationship is a type of

A Product_class is an identification of a set of similar products to be offered to the market. Product_class objects that are related to each other by a do not inherit any characteristics from each other.
The following figure depicts a detail of an example of a structure that is built up by Product_class and objects.
the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Product_class. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Product_class.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Product_class.

the level of the Product_class in a hierarchical structure of Product_class objects.
A high level Product_class (level_type = 'enterprise') may be used to define all and objects for all Product_class objects of an enterprise with several brands and companies. A second level Product_class (level_type = 'platform') may be used to group all products that are based on the same technical concept (platform); these products may belong to different brands. A third level Product_class (level_type = 'car family') may be used to group all products that have a common base and a fixed set of characteristics (specification categories). A fourth level Product_class (level_type = 'car type') may represent products that are offered to the market; this level of Product_class may be defined by the marketing department. A set of specifications sufficient to produce the car is associated with its Product_class. Within this association, a distinction is made between standard characteristics (e.g. number of doors) and options that have to be chosen (e.g., outside colour) or that may be chosen by the customer (e.g., radio).
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the words or group of words by which the market of the Product_class is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that identifies a marketing category of the Product_class. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the words by which the Product_class is known.
'69 Buick Electra', 'Bugatti Royal', 'Pacific 213', and 'Airbus A320' are examples for name.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification of a particular version of a Product_class. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Product_class_relationship is a relationship between two objects. The meaning of this relationship is specified further by the attribute relation_type.

the text that provides further information about the Product_class_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the second of the two objects related by the Product_class_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

the first of the two objects related by the Product_class_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

A Property_assignment is a mechanism to assign a to an object.
the value that is being assigned.

the text that provides further information about the Property_assignment.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the context in which a Property_assignment is applicable. The value of this attribute need not be specified. A Cost_property is applicable in the context of supplier A and may be different if the item is supplied by a different supplier B.
Software can be used in different product classes, specified by the validity_context, with different parameter values.
A Property_change is a mechanism to describe the differences between two objects concerning the properties of these objects.

the set of objects that have been added to that object of the described relationship that is identified as relating. the set of objects that have been added to that object of the described relationship that is identified as relating. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Property_change. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the objects that have been deleted from that object of the described relationship that is identified as relating. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the that collects the Property_change objects and the objects.
the text that provides further information about the Property_change.

the identifier for the Property_change.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Property_definition is the definition of a particular quality. A property_definition may reflect physics or arbitrary user defined measurements.

other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Property_definition.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the unit or set of units that are accepted. The value of this attribute need not be specified. A company may accept a mass specified in kilograms or tons, but not in grams or pounds. A representing the Property_definition shall not be expressed with a that is not contained in the allowed_unit, if the allowed_unit is specified. If specified, the 'global_unit' attribute of a representing the shall be contained in the allowed_unit, if the allowed_unit is specified.

the text that provides further information about the Property_definition.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Property_definition.
the or object that defines this kind of property_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification of a particular version of a Property_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Property_definition_relationship.

the second of the two objects related by the Property_definition_relationship. The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.
the first of the two objects related by the Property_definition_relationship. The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.
A Property_relationship is a relationship between two objects.

the text that provides further information about the Property_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the second of the two objects related by the Property_relationship. NOTE The semantics of this attribute is defined by the attribute relation_type.
specifies the first of the two objects related by the Property_relationship. NOTE The semantics of this attribute is defined by the attribute relation_type.
A Property_value is the numerical or textual value of a .

the words by which the Property_value is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified. 'l1' or 'vol2' are examples for the value_name of a Property_value.

The itself is referenced by .assigned_property ’noise absorption’, ’power consumption’ or 'colour' are examples for the value_type of a Simple_property.

A Unit is a quantity chosen as a standard in terms of which other quantities may be expressed. The types of units supported by this standard are SI units as well as derived or conversion based units as defined in ISO 10303-41.
specifies the system in which the Unit is defined. 'SI system'
the words by which the Unit is known. 'meter', 'gram', 'gram','litre', or 'volt' are examples for the name.
specifies a possible prefix for the name. The value of this attribute need not be specified. 'milli', 'kilo' are examples for the prefix
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Value_limit is a type of
with a qualified numerical value representing either the lower limit or the upper limit of a particular physical characteristic. '30.5 max' and '5 min' are examples for a Value_limit.
specifies the value of the limit.

A Value_list is a type of
with an ordered collection of Property_value objects. A may be composed of different property values such as 'mass', 'speed', and 'age' which are altogether necessary in a given context. The Value_list collects all of them in a given order, such that each is identifiable by its index in the list.
specifies the ordered collection of objects that together are provided as a .

A Value_range is a type of
with apair of numerical values representing the range in which the value shall lie.
specifies the minimum acceptable value that is constrained by the Value_range.
specifies the maximum acceptable value that is constrained by the Value_range.

A Value_with_unit is a type of
with either a single numerical measure, or a range of numerical measures with upper, lower, or upper and lower bounds.

specifies the number of decimal digits that are relevant for the use of the Value_with_unit. If present, the numerical measure or range may be specified using more digits than the significant digits but shall not be specified using less digits. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the unit in which the Value_with_unit is expressed.
